parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To revile a person to his face, abuse insultingly. From loidoros; to reproach, i.e. Vilify.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.

str2: To endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.
